main event: On June 29, 1954, in Danvers, Massachusetts, a bright, round, and very bright object, believed to be a flying saucer, was observed moving rapidly across the sky towards the northeast. The size of the object appeared to be approximately the same as the moon, and it was visible for about 15 seconds. It did not make any noise and left no trail as it disappeared.
interesting points: The observation was made by a civilian on the rear porch of his home, and the sighting lasted for about 15 seconds.
The object was observed moving in a straight line at a phenomenal speed and appeared to remain steady and solid without blinking or flashing.
The report mentioned that the object traveled in a straight line and its speed was estimated to be phenomenal.
The document indicates that the use of binoculars was not successful in observing the object, and there were no photographs included in the report.

The investigation of unusual reports filed at CIA Traffic Control Center did not indicate any abnormal conditions in the area of the sighting, and the possible cause of the sighting was unidentified by the reporting officer.
sighted object: bright, round, and very bright object moving rapidly across the sky
witnesses: civilian on the rear porch of his home
photographs: no photographs included in the report
